channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole up against a rubber “sleeping policeman “ ramp, 2nd April
item.description:
Turning into Bath Terrace off the Bath Road towards car park. Large pothole a butting rubber ramp. Vehicles dipping into hole then hitting ramp.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5a, Bath Terrace, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing street sign, 2nd April
item.description:
Missing street sign for Inkerman Lane on corner with Andover Road (A40). The board is on the building but the sign itself must have been lost, dammed or removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Inkerman Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: States it has been fixed, but it has not!, 2nd April
item.description:
Why do every pot hole incident say it has been repaired on this road?, but it clearly hasn't! this road is dangerous! cars swerve into the ongoing lane to avoid these huge pot holes all day. This needs sorting asap. I cannot believe the council think this has been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Greenhills Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Channel across the road not properly filled so has a sharp edge to hit, 2nd April
item.description:
On the way to the roundabout towards Bishops Cleeve. Incomplete repair to roadwork channel, you can't see it how bad it is until you have hit it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 2nd April
item.description:
(From 11483493) 28/03/25 FMS passed from CBC ::: Lopping of large aged Plane tree with TPO - The tree is located on Parabola Road near Cheltenham Ladies College St Austin’s House. The beautiful mature Plane tree was severely lopped last week. As the tree is located well away from any buildings I cannot believe there was any justification for the desecration of such a beautiful tree. Surely TPO’s are placed on such trees for good reason. Could you please explain why such action was taken? Many thanks
Report on FixMyStreet
